result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge          (NOTE: 11/03 approved by the judge)
Return date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

11:33 AM Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson in court for MAXWELL A DECKER.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. State has one witness.

Noah Knetzger sworn, direct by DA Laspisa, is employed by City of Berlin Police Department as a Corporal Detective. Testimony given. Was employed on the date in question. Venue established. Identified the defendant present in court. Cross examination by Atty Nelson. Re-direct by DA Laspisa. Re-cross by Atty Nelson. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court and copy to Atty Nelson and mirrors the criminal complaint. Attorney Nelson and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set 2022CF101 for Return Date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 AM. 

Court adjourned at 11:50 AM
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson in court for MAXWELL A DECKER.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests a preliminary hearing. Court sets Preliminary Hearing for October 31, 2022 at 11:30 AM. 1/2 hour.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on October 24, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Atty Scott Nelson
Second appearance on October 24, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

2:51 PM Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Green appeared by video for MAXWELL A DECKER.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF28, 2022CF46 & 2022CF101. On 2022CF101 - Atty Kapelis was appointed on this case. 2022CF28 & 2022CF46 - Court denies the motion to dismiss. Statement by the defendant - Atty kapelis withdrew. Court sets 2022CF101 - for Status of Counsel on October 24, 2022 at 3:15 PM and will track the other 2 cases. Court questions Atty Green if he would take a court appointment if no attorney was appointed in this case. Statement by Atty Green.

Court adjourned at 2:55 PM
Atty Michael Kapelis
Second appearance on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:53 PM Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for MAXWELL A DECKER on 2022CF101. Atty Kapelis states the defendant is requesting the him to withdraw. Defendant concurs. Court has no objection. Court makes statement to the defendant re: counsel. Court grants the motion. Atty Kapelis to submit an order. Statement by DA Laspisa. Court sets for Status of Counsel on October 4, 2022 at 2;30 pm.

Court adjourned at 3:56 PM.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:49 PM Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Green in court for MAXWELL A DECKER on 2022CF46 & 2022CF28. Attorney Michael Kapelis in court for Maxwell Decker on 2022CF101.   Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls all cases 2022CF46, 2022CF101 and 2022CF28. On 2022CF28-Court goes over the motion filed by the defense and will hold open and file a written decision. 

Atty Green states the defendant will waive the prelim on 2022CF46. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Green. Attorney Green waives any reading. Atty Green states the defendant stands mute. Court enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on October 3, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

2022CF101 Statement by Atty Kapelis - defendant requests a prelim be scheduled. Statement by DA, had contact with the victim in which the defendant has made contact with her via text.

Court adjourned at 3:56 PM

Court sets 2022CF101 for Preliminary Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 3:30 PM.
(by Atty Michael Kapelis)
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on July 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
